ðŸ’¡ Menstrudel | Dart
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with a private, offline, and intuitive mobile application for tracking their menstrual cycle, managing birth control pills, and receiving timely reminders and predictions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Log with a Tap â€¢ Track flow, pain, and symptoms â€¢ View menstrual history â€¢ Accurate period forecasts â€¢ Understand cycle length and variations
ðŸ“– Summary: Menstrudel is a free, private, and open-source period and pill tracking mobile application built with Flutter. It offers smart cycle tracking, predictive insights, effortless pill management, LARC tracking, and customizable reminders, with all data stored securely offline on the user's device.

âœ¨ pop | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Sending emails directly from the command line, enabling automation and integration with other terminal-based workflows.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Send emails from the terminal â€¢ Text-based User Interface (TUI) â€¢ Command Line Interface (CLI) â€¢ Support for Resend API â€¢ Support for SMTP configuration
ðŸ“– Summary: Pop is a command-line tool written in Go that allows users to send emails directly from their terminal. It supports both a text-based user interface (TUI) and a command-line interface (CLI), offering flexibility for different workflows. Pop can integrate with email services like Resend or traditional SMTP, and can be combined with other CLI tools for advanced email automation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ svelte | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building performant web applications by compiling components into efficient JavaScript.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Compiler-based approach â€¢ No virtual DOM â€¢ Efficient DOM updates â€¢ Declarative component syntax â€¢ Highly performant JavaScript output
ðŸ“– Summary: Svelte is a modern JavaScript compiler that shifts work from the browser to the build step. It compiles your declarative component code into efficient, imperative JavaScript that surgically updates the DOM, resulting in highly performant applications without the overhead of a virtual DOM.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ call-center-ai | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating and enhancing customer service interactions through AI-driven phone calls, handling tasks like IT support, insurance inquiries, and general customer service.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-powered outbound and inbound calls â€¢ Integration with Azure and OpenAI GPT (gpt-4.1, gpt-4.1-nano) â€¢ Real-time conversation streaming and resume after disconnections â€¢ Support for multiple languages and voice tones â€¢ SMS information exchange
ðŸ“– Summary: Call Center AI is a Python-based solution that leverages Azure and OpenAI GPT to enable AI-powered phone calls. It allows for both initiating outbound calls from an AI agent via API and direct inbound calls to a configured bot number, suitable for various customer service applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ galaxy | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing developers with a vast collection of pre-designed UI components to quickly build and style web interfaces.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Over 3000 unique UI elements â€¢ Community-made and free to use â€¢ Implemented with CSS or Tailwind â€¢ Sourced from Uiverse.io platform â€¢ MIT License
ðŸ“– Summary: Galaxy is a large, community-driven open-source UI library containing over 3000 unique UI elements. These elements are sourced from Uiverse.io and can be implemented using CSS or Tailwind.
